summary: 10/26/1993: A gunman opened fire on diners at a luxury hotel on the River Nile, killing three people--two of them Americans--and wounding five.
target1: Coffee shop of the Semiramis Intercontinental Hotel
addnotes: American, French, Syrian and Italian citizens also fell victim to the attack.
scite1: Kim Murphy, “Cairo Killings not Linked to Terror Campaign, Officials Say,” Los Angeles Times, October 28, 1993.
scite2: "Cairo Gunman Kills 2 Americans and Frenchman,” The New York Times, October 27, 1993.
scite3: Caryle Murphy, “Egyptian Kills Tourists in Cairo Luxury Hotel,” The Washington Post, October 27, 1993.
